image.altText: A woman mines in Porgera

props.synopsis: PNG's Porgera gold mine could potentially transform the fortunes of an impoverished province now that it has reopened. But some locals say they've experienced considerable environmental damage from the mine's waste and tailings.

title.children: $7bn of gold is buried in these PNG hills. The battle to claim it has been called 'Game of Thrones on crack'

image.altText: Cliffs, sand and surf at Ethel Beach in South Australia.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy has died in a shark attack near Ethel Beach — a popular spot for tourism and surfing on the south-western tip of South Australia's Yorke Peninsula.

title.children: Teen killed in shark attack off coast of Yorke Peninsula in SA

image.altText: Photo of woman with running shoes and in running gear smiling

props.synopsis: Tanya Hehir, 46, was one of three women who went exploring the so-called "love tunnel" in Gympie. Police said the women, including another 40-year-old who also died, had been washed back through the drain into Mary River.

title.children: Police confirm identity of woman who died while exploring 'love tunnel' stormwater drain in Gympie

image.altText: Palestinian woman Iman holds her newborn twins Uday and Hamza Abu Odah at Nasser hospital.

props.synopsis: Doctors and residents say women in Gaza are giving birth in horrific and dangerous conditions, with mothers and their babies dying after childbirth due to a lack of medical supplies. WARNING: This story contains distressing content.

title.children: There are 180 babies born in Gaza every day but doctors say a safe labour is nearly 'impossible'

image.altText: A medium shot of a number of people, including children, sitting and standing amid mattresses in the tray of a truck

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of already displaced Palestinian families take part in a new mass exodus in central Gaza.

title.children: New exodus of thousands causes havoc in central Gaza as Israeli forces advance

image.altText: Mawson Station, Antarctica

props.synopsis: The Australian Antarctic Division's bid to improve culture and morale within its workforce continues to face significant hurdles, with an internal survey showing almost a third of female respondents not reporting the harassment and bullying they've experienced or seen in recent months.

title.children: 'Trust has been shattered': Leaked survey reveals ongoing cultural issues at Australian Antarctic Division

image.altText: Jack Kamilian, Tamborine Mountain

props.synopsis: Jack Kamilian clearly remembers the sound he heard before a tree split his home in half.

title.children: Residents reflect on near-miss as authorities work to reopen roads after Queensland tornado

image.altText: Rescuers stand by wreckage of a passenger plane that crashed in Pokhara, Nepal.

props.synopsis: A Yeti Airlines crash in Nepal that killed 72 people almost a year ago was caused by the pilots mistakenly cutting power leading to an aerodynamic stall.

title.children: Investigative panel finds deadly Nepal crash was due to pilot error

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A young mother leans down over her sleeping baby, kissing her on the cheek.

props.synopsis: Paramedic Dominique Daye felt confident she would take being a mum in her stride, but it wasn't what she expected. She's encouraging others to use new support tools when things get tough.

title.children: Dominique suffered postpartum psychosis after her son's birth. She wants new parents to know help is available

image.altText: Mir Hamza celebrates with Babar Azam

props.synopsis: Pakistan was in pole position to win the Boxing Day Test after rolling Australia's top order, but a costly drop slammed the brakes on the tourists's momentum. Here's the five quick hits from day three at the MCG.

title.children: Five quick hits — Pakistan blows its chance after an Australian collapse and Captain Pat steps up

image.altText: Two Australian batters run between the wickets during a women's ODI against India.

props.synopsis: After losing the one-off Test to India before Christmas, Australia pulls off an incredible run chase on its way to a comfortable victory at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium in the opening ODI.

title.children: Australia cruises to six-wicket ODI win over India

image.altText: Labelling on a packet of Doritos corn chips.

props.synopsis: A union claims workers at a Smith's Chips factory in Adelaide have been experiencing breathing difficulties and skin irritation from a seasoning used on a spicy snack food.

title.children: Spicy Doritos seasoning leaving factory workers with 'skin irritation' and 'difficulty breathing', union claims

image.altText: A watercolour illustration of a woman in her 70s looking pensive, with her hands held up to her face.

props.synopsis: As Adelaide-based novelist Carol Lefevre approached 70 years of age, she was struck with a strange feeling of homesickness — not for a place, but for a time.

title.children: Do you ever feel 'homesick' for your younger self? You're not alone

image.altText: A close up of a man and a younger man smiling slightly while standing behind glass. Reflected in the glass is a room of people

props.synopsis: A Moscow court sentences two poets to years-long prison terms after they were convicted of "inciting hatred".

title.children: Russian poets sentenced to prison for reciting poems against Ukraine war

image.altText: Girl in pajamas on coach, blowing her nose with a long-haired cat on her lap

props.synopsis: Humans have been living alongside cats and dogs for thousands of years. But that doesn't mean we're always compatible. What can you do as an animal lover with pet allergies?

title.children: Do you love animals but are allergic to pets? It still may be possible to have a furry friend if you're lucky

image.altText: A man, woman and child carry luggage as they wade through knee-deep water in front of a barbed wire fence.

props.synopsis: Mexico's president says he is willing to help, but wants to see progress in US relations with Cuba and Venezuela, along with more development aid for the region.

title.children: Mexico uses bulldozers, machetes to clear migrant camp on US border as US secretary of state visits Mexico City

image.altText: Larissa Fletcher and James Wilfred-Derby

props.synopsis: Veterans are swapping combat boots for ballet shoes as part of a new program aimed at helping improve their mental health.

title.children: After a decade of service, James struggled to adjust to life after war — then he found ballet

image.altText: An aerial view of the small NT town of Larrimah.

props.synopsis: Years after one of its dozen residents vanished without a trace, a Netflix documentary is bringing a global audience of millions to the mystery that looms over the remote Northern Territory town of Larrimah.

title.children: How a tiny Aussie outback town became a global true-crime phenomenon

image.altText: Swirling water that appears sandy brown.

props.synopsis: People are being warned not to swim in bays around Melbourne following recent severe storms. So why does the water quality drop when it rains?

title.children: Ever wondered why you can't swim at some beaches after severe storms?

image.altText: A large puppy with light-coloured fur sits on a bed, wearing headphones.

props.synopsis: From safe spaces to desensitisation, experts share their tips on how to help prepare your pets for very noisy events.

title.children: Whimpers and bangs: How to look after your dogs during New Year’s Eve fireworks

image.altText: The icon for the video sharing TikTok app is seen on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: The Australian Information Commissioner is inquiring into social media giant TikTok's handling of personal data and allegations it took data without consent.

title.children: Australian privacy watchdog investigating claims TikTok harvests your data even if you don't have the app

image.altText: A woman cries in front of a car.

props.synopsis: Two people are under arrest following an alleged burglary at the home of accused triple murderer Erin Patterson in Victoria's east.

title.children: Two arrested over robbery at home of Victoria's fatal mushroom meal

image.altText: A Hong Kong police car.

props.synopsis: Ho Yu-wang, 20, Kwok Man-hei, 21, and Cheung Ho-yeung, 23, were all charged with "conspiracy to commit terrorism" under the National Security Law.

title.children: Hong Kong activists jailed for up to six years over foiled bomb plot

image.altText: Gypsy Rose Blanchard wearing glasses hugs her mother Clauddine Blanchard as well as a small puppy

props.synopsis: Gypsy Rose Blanchard, 32, is set to be released on parole after being jailed for secondary-degree murder over the killing of her mother, who forced her to pretend she was suffering from Leukaemia, muscular dystrophy and other illnesses.

title.children: US woman Gypsy Rose Blanchard set to be paroled years after persuading boyfriend to kill abusive mother

image.altText: An old stone building with a vineyard.

props.synopsis: Tourism leaders say South Australia's Limestone Coast needs more accommodation to suit a range of budgets to reach its full potential as a holiday destination.

title.children: It has world-class wines and scenery galore, but a lack of tourist beds could be holding this region back

image.altText: Woman weep opening whle wearing black and yellow sashes while holding pictures of three people

props.synopsis: Australian man Ali Bazzi, who Hezbollah said was a fighter, and his brother Ibrahim, along with Ibrahim's wife Shorouk Hammoud, died when the explosion levelled a family-owned home in southern Lebanon on Tuesday.

title.children: Military-style funeral held for Australian 'Hezbollah fighter' killed by Israeli air strike in Lebanon

image.altText: A sign reading welcome to Rosebud Pier, with the pier behind it.

props.synopsis: A man has been found dead after disappearing off the coast of Rosebud, on Melbourne's Mornington Peninsula.

title.children: Body of missing kayaker recovered from water off Melbourne's Mornington Peninsula

image.altText: A large hailstone being held in a person's hand.

props.synopsis: Massive storms across Australia have left giant hailstones in people's backyards. Scientists hope you won't let them melt and will instead preserve the icy lumps for weather research.

title.children: Do you have giant hailstones at your place? Don't just take photos, put them in your freezer for science

image.altText: Composite image of Lisa Marie Presley, Burt Bacharach and Tina Turner.

props.synopsis: From punk rockers to crooners, best friends to magicians, the world lost some well known faces and creative geniuses this year.

title.children: Looking back at the celebrities who died this year
